subject: p18322589
History: CHF and hypoxia and elevated INR, fluid overload versus DAH, status post intubation, evaluate ETT placement.
Findings: One AP portable view of the chest. Endotracheal tube ends 3 cm from the carina. Nasogastric tube ends in the stomach. Left AICD device leads terminate in the appropriate positions. After ETT placement, there are increased lung volumes, and still severe pulmonary edema. Cardiomegaly is stable. Small right pleural effusion is stable. Retrocardiac atelectasis is unchanged. No evidence of pneumonia. Sternotomy wires are seen.
Impression: Endotracheal tube ends 3 cm from the carina. Better lung volumes after intubation but still severe pulmonary edema.
